recipe.title: Sheet Pan Shrimp Boil Recipe by Tasty

ingredients.ingredient: 1 lb ; baby dutch yellow potato ; (455 g)
3 ears ; corn, husked and cut crosswise into 6 pieces
¼ cup ; unsalted butter, melted ; (55 g)
1 lb ; medium shrimp, peeled and deveined ; (455 g)
12.8 oz ; smoked andouille sausage, 1 package, thinly sliced ; (360 g)

steps.step: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook potatoes until just tender and parboiled, about 10-13 minutes. Stir in corn during the last 5 minutes of cooking time and drain well.
In a small bowl, combine butter, garlic, and Old Bay Seasoning.
Place potatoes, corn, shrimp and sausage in a single layer onto a greased baking sheet. Gently toss with the butter mixture.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the shrimp are opaque and corn is tender.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges, and sprinkle with parsley.

steps_updated.steps_updated: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook potatoes until just tender and parboiled, about 10-13 minutes.
Stir in corn during the last 5 minutes of cooking time and drain well.
In a small bowl, combine butter, garlic, and Old Bay Seasoning.
Place potatoes, corn, shrimp and sausage in a single layer onto a greased baking sheet.
Gently toss with the butter mixture.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the shrimp are opaque and corn is tender.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges, and sprinkle with parsley.
